statement:
The *Hewitt–Marczewski–Pondiczery Theorem* is a result on the density of
products of topological spaces. This theorem was arrived at
independently by Hewitt[@hewitt], Marczewski[@marcz] and
Pondiczery[@pond] in the 1940s.

Let $\kappa$ be an infinite cardinal number and $S$ an index set of
cardinality at most $2^\kappa$. If $X_s$ $(s\in S)$ are topological
spaces with $d(X_s)\le\kappa$ then
$$d\left(\prod_{s\in S}X_s\right)\le\kappa.$$

The special case $\kappa=\aleph_0$ says that the product of at most
continuum many separable spaces is separable.

Bull. Amer. Math. Soc. 52 (1946), 641–643. (This paper is available as a

multiplication cartésienne des espaces topologiques*]{}, Fund. Math. 34
(1947), 127–143. (This paper is available as a PDF file from the Polish
Virtual Library of Science: .) E. S. Pondiczery, [*Power problems in
abstract spaces*]{}, Duke Math. J. 11 (1944), 835–837.
